engineering_design_principles.mechanism: Observing and using certain features as indicators or evidence to gain valuable information about the early stages of a phenomenon
Choosing materials that can withstand specific conditions or processes, such as the unchanged materials in comets
Managing the flow and transformation of matter and energy within a system to optimize performance or function, like comets redistributing matter and energy
Forcing atomic nuclei to combine, releasing immense energy, as observed in comets' nuclei composed of rock and ice
Utilizing the pressure exerted by electromagnetic radiation to generate force or motion, as seen in the tail direction of a comet
Applying mathematical and engineering principles to explain and predict natural phenomena, such as comet orbits, tail direction, and brightness
